description: Daria quietly hands Innovator allies at Bar 101 a modified algorithm for the new feedback portal—one that allows a narrow path for genuine corrections, though most appeals will be blocked.

The Citizen Feedback portal launches, drawing a surge of applications from citizens seeking correction to their BCI scores. A select few experience success, while the majority find their appeals rejected or ignored.
Encrypted chat groups begin to share survival tips and subtle strategies to avoid portal rejection. Open dissatisfaction bubbles beneath the surface, though public order remains intact.
Innovators host a public event highlighting the Citizen Feedback portal’s apparent transparency. Many residents express both hope and skepticism, citing inconsistent outcomes of submitted appeals.
System diagnostics confirm that most critical or dissenting appeals are algorithmically labeled 'disruptive' and filtered out. Only uncontroversial corrections proceed, preserving system stability.

Government broadcasts promote the fairness of the new system, showcasing a handful of restored records as proof. Users quickly notice that negative or critical posts are disappearing from public feeds.

Daily life normalizes around the new portal as citizens adapt, but encrypted circles quietly circulate underground guides for those determined to challenge BCI decisions. True unrest remains hidden from view.
